thread.title: 4 Maute members wanted for crimes, drugs nabbed in Lanao
thread.title_full: 4 Maute members wanted for crimes, drugs nabbed in Lanao

title: 4 Maute members wanted for crimes, drugs nabbed in Lanao
text:
Nation ( Leaderboard Top ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 4 Maute members wanted for crimes, drugs nabbed in Lanao By Roel Pareño (philstar.com) | Updated March 18, 2017 - 4:30pm The suspects were wanted for illicit activities such as kidnap-for-ransom, gun-for-hire, carnapping, extortion and illegal drugs trade in the provinces of Lanao del Sur and Lanao del Norte. Philstar.com/File photo 
ZAMBOANGA CITY, Philippines - At least four members of the Islamic State-inspired Maute group, wanted for crimes, were captured during a military-led operation in Lanao del Sur, said security official on Saturday. 
The suspects identified as Pao Panganga (alias Pao Faizal), Alex Areg Bagul, Alisata Tumao Maute and Saadra Macapanton Madayan, were captured about 3 a.m. Thursday in a village of Lanao del Sur by the joint-military team under the Joint Task Task ZamPeLan (Zamboanga Peninsula and Lanao). 
Capt. Jo-Ann Petinglay, spokesperson of the Western Mindanao Command (Westmincom), said the troops recovered from the suspects three high-powered firearms, a pistol, improvised explosive devices (IEDs) and drug paraphernalia. 
According to Petinglay, the suspects known to have rogue personalities, were wanted for illegal activities such as kidnap-for-ransom, gun-for-hire, carnapping, extortion and illegal drugs trade in the provinces of Lanao del Sur and Lanao del Norte. 
Pentinglay said the suspects were also tagged in the ambush of Police Superintendent Abner Wahab Santos, former city police director of Marawi City Police. 
According to Petinglay, Panganga was involved in the series of kidnappings in Marawi City, specifically the abduction of Omira Lotao, an employee of the Mindanao State University on March 5. Nation ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 
Maj. Gen. Carlito Galvez Jr., Westmincom chief, said the arrest of the suspects was a result of vital intelligence information. 
Galvez said they were very critical in giving out information and details of the operations of the military forces on the ground, describing the IS-inspired group with strong network in monitoring movement of the troops. Nation ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1
